abstract.text: A view that represents the insertion indicator in text.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: to display the insertion indicator. You can use this indicator if you have your own text engine or need to display an indicator elsewhere.
To use the indicator, instantiate an

, then add the view to your view hierarchy. Set the indicator view’s frame to where you want to display a text insertion indicator. The indicator has the same height as the indicator view’s frame, and centers horizontally within the indicator view’s frame.
specifies whether the indicator hides, remains visible, or blinks (automatic).

, the indicator stops blinking when you set the frame. The indicator starts blinking when the frame doesn’t change for a period of time. When the user dictates, the indicator displays a trailing glow when it is moved.
when your custom view becomes the first responder. When your custom view resigns first responder, set the
to indicate that key events aren’t sent to your view.
By default the indicator’s color is
. You can set a different color.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
A set of methods that the destination object (or recipient) of a dragged image must implement.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A list of alternative strings for a piece of text.
A protocol that describes specific kinds of input content types.
Text the user can select or edit to send an action message to a target when the user presses the Return key.
A set of methods that text views need to implement to interact properly with the text input management system.
An object that represents the Cocoa text input system.
A view that represents the insertion indicator in text.
Options that affect the automatic display mode.
Constants that determine how to display the system text cursor in a custom text UI.
Options that affect the automatic display mode.
The color of this indicator.
A value that describes the display mode of an indicator.
An optional closure the system calls during dictation.
A view that draws text and handles user interactions with that text.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
Incorporate the system text cursor into your custom text UI in AppKit.

abstract.text: A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
